properties.Notes: This is definitely Baluchaung II. The sequence is, however, confusing, and there would appear to be four dams here, not just three.

Not sure if this is a dam - may just be infrastructure. But assuming the sequence runs from Baluchaung 1 through 3, from north to south; and we know Baluchaung 2 is correct, then this is the only structure that can be Baluchaung 3.
An article dated Sept. 03, 2013 in the Shan Herald claims that India has cancelled the dam.

properties.Transmission Line Connected to S\/S\n: 230-kV TL Thaton SS and 33 kV TL Myainnggyingu SS MYA

properties.Notes: http://globalenergyobservatory.org/geoid/41489; note that the Zawgyi dam and associated reservoir provides water to two hydroelectric plants: Zawgyi 1(18 MW) and Zawgyi 2 (12 MW). Hence, total megawattage associated with the dam is 30 MW.
